newsitem.title: ESTONIA: FIXED ASSET INVESTMENTS UP 34 PCT IN Q1.
newsitem.headline: FIXED ASSET INVESTMENTS UP 34 PCT IN Q1.

text.p: Investment into fixed assets and leasing rose by 34 percent in the first quarter of 1997 compared to the first quarter of 1996, the statistics office said on Thursday.
Invesments in fixed assets rose to 1.8 billion kroons in the first quarter compared to 1.3 billion kroons in the first quarter of last year, the office said in its monthly statistics bulletin.

One billion kroons was invested into purchasing equipment, machinery, inventory items and vehicles, of which 26 percent was invested into vehicles and 14 percent into computer equipment in the first quarter 1997.
Investments into buildings and construction was down as a proportion to total investments in the first quarter of 1997 to 24 percent compared to 29 percent.
However, the total investment into construction and buildings rose to 430.7 million kroons compared to 385.1 million kroons.
